poem:
### Tensions in the Air  
  
In the heat of distant lands,  
echoes cascade, shrapnel whispers.  
The skyline crumbles,  
sundials of smoke and dust.  
Borders drawn with trembling hands;  
a dance of shadows, fate unwound.  
Words unsaid, carried by winds  
across seas, like prayers unanswered,  
or echoes of thunder  
from a storm yet to break.
